Overview: AP EAMCET (EAPCET) 2026 is the Andhra Pradesh Engineering, Agriculture, and Pharmacy Common Entrance Test, conducted annually by Jawaharlal Nehru Technological University (JNTU) Kakinada on behalf of APSCHE for admission into various undergraduate programs in Engineering (B.Tech/B.E.), Agriculture (B.Sc. Agriculture/Horticulture), and Pharmacy (B.Pharm/Pharm-D) at participating colleges within Andhra Pradesh. The exam is a computer-based test taken by over 2 lakh aspirants for engineering and about 80,000 for agriculture/pharmacy.

Eligibility.Domicile: Andhra Pradesh/Telangana as per local/non-local status guidelines

Minimum Age.Agriculture & Allied Courses: 17 years minimum; maximum 22 years (25 for SC/ST)

Educational Qualification.Engineering: Passed/appearing 10+2 with Mathematics, Physics, Chemistry; diploma holders eligible
Educational Qualification.Agriculture & Pharmacy: Passed/appearing 10+2 with Physics, Chemistry, Biology/Mathematics; diploma holders eligible

Eligibility.Additional: Candidates appearing in 2026 board exams can apply; eligibility finalized at admission

Steps: Fill and submit application form, upload scanned photo/signature
Correction window for editable details in May 2026

Exam Pattern.Languages: English & Telugu; Urdu only at Kurnool center

Questions.Type: All MCQs, 1 mark per correct answer, no negative marking

Foundation.Based On: Andhra Pradesh Board of Intermediate Education (BIEAP) Class 11 & 12 curriculum
Foundation.Description: The syllabus for AP EAMCET 2026 strictly aligns with the Andhra Pradesh Board of Intermediate Education (BIEAP) Class 11 & 12 curriculum. It caters to the Engineering (PCM) and Agriculture & Pharmacy (PCMB or PCB) streams, integrating the full spectrum of academic topics necessary for competitive entrance performance. Extensive cross-referencing with NCERT Class 11 & 12 syllabus ensures consistency and national-level academic standards.

Algebra: Binomial Theorem with proof and applications
Trigonometry: Solutions of Triangles including Height and Distance
Probability and Statistics: Mean, Median, Mode, Standard Deviation, Variance
Application to Discrete and Continuous Distributions
Coordinate Geometry: Straight Lines and Pair of Lines
Circles, Parabola, Ellipse, Hyperbola (construction and properties)
Calculus: Integration: Indefinite, Definite Integrals, Areas under Curves
Differential Equations: First Order and Separable Variables

Mechanics: Kinematics, Laws of Motion, Work, Energy, Power
Rotational Motion, Centre of Mass and Momentum
Thermodynamics: Laws of Thermodynamics, Heat Engines, Carnot Cycle
Optics: Reflection, Refraction, Image Formation by Lenses and Mirrors
Waves: Types of Mechanical Waves, Doppler Effect

Atomic Structure and Chemical Bonding: Bohr Model, Quantum Mechanical Model, Hybridization
Ionic, Covalent Bonds, VBT and MOT
States of Matter: Gas Laws, Liquids and Solids Properties
Organic Chemistry: Functional Groups: Alcohol, Phenol, Ether, Aldehyde, Ketone, Carboxylic Acids
Inorganic Chemistry: Periodic Table Trends, s/p/d/f block Elements Properties
Environmental Chemistry: Pollution Types, Control Methods, Green Chemistry Initiatives

Cell Structure and Functions: Cell Organelles, Cell Cycle & Division (Mitosis, Meiosis)
Reproduction: Sexual and Asexual Reproduction, Pollination, Fertilization
Genetics and Evolution: Mendelian Laws, Genetic Disorders, Variation and Evolutionary Mechanisms
Ecology: Ecosystem Structure, Food Chains, Ecological Succession

Evolution: Fossil Records, Natural Selection Theories, Adaptive Radiation
Biotechnology: Genetic Engineering Basics, Cloning, PCR Techniques

Agriculture & Pharmacy Stream.Physics & Chemistry: Follow the Engineering stream syllabus as physics and chemistry topics are unified across streams.

Preparation Recommendations: Utilize NCERT textbooks as primary study material; follow Andhra Pradesh Intermediate pattern
Emphasize understanding fundamentals through problem-solving exercises
Prioritize chapters based on weightage and past exam trends
Practice repeated online mock exams for CBT interface familiarization
Divide study time judiciously balancing conceptual clarity and exam speed

Cutoff.Minimum Qualifying Marks: 40/160 (25%) for General; no minimum for SC/ST

Steps: Reporting to allotted college with documents
Counselling.Seat Allocation: Based on AP EAMCET rank, reservation, local/non-local status, web options, and seat availability
Counselling.Additional Rounds: Internal branch sliding and spot rounds for unfilled seats
